Judas Priest - Epitaph


image Wikipedia:
Judas Priest are a British heavy metal band formed in Birmingham, England in 1969.[1] Known for twin lead guitars, a wide operatic vocal style, and for introducing the S&M leather-and-studs look into heavy metal, they have sold over 50 million albums worldwide.

Reliving the electrifying thrills and spills of a historic rock show in an air-conditioned cinema aisle may be considered second-rate entertainment to the mind of any right-thinking metal maniac. But as a band whose every blistering riff and leather-clad swagger looms large with the otherworldly essence of heavy metal, the theatrical vision with which Judas PriestÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s closing Ã¢â‚¬ËœEpitaphÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ date is captured only heightens their already towering stage presence.

In a sustained, 142-minute assault on the senses that sees these genre-forging Brits revisit their immense 14-album discography, this rare performance is rendered with all the explosive audio and acrobatic camera angles youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢d expect of such an outing. But with every era of Judas PriestÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s 40-year career being recreated in the iconic visuals that define each influential album, itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s clear that Ã¢â‚¬ËœEpitaphÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ is no simple retrospective and, as such demands ample cinematic imagination. With its lingering close-ups and whirling overhead shots being ignited in a white-hot haze of light, Ã¢â‚¬ËœStarbreakerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ is particularly abuzz with fan euphoria, with Rob HalfordÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s operatic pipes ricocheting off expansive surround sound audio.

Judas PriestÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s legendary musicianship is always a supreme spectacle to behold in any medium, but never before has the passion and pageantry of their sound been so vividly brought to life until now.
[4/5] Faye Coulman

And then, of course, youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve got to have a track from Ã¢â‚¬ËœPainkillerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ which you can play live, every track off Ã¢â‚¬ËœBritish SteelÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ which you could play live, Ã¢â‚¬ËœScreaming For VengeanceÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ and on and on and on.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½
Is it fair to say that the Ã¢â‚¬ËœEpitaphÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ tour, and this DVD, marks the end of a chapter for Priest?
Ã¢â‚¬Å“Just in one small respect, itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not the end of Judas Priest by any stretch of the imagination; weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re in the studio now as we speak tracking all of the new material; weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re just cutting back a little bit so we can still get out there and do the great shows that we want to do. I just want to be able to go out there and not look sad and punch drunk and I think that youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve just kind of look at what you need to do to make sure that when people see you, they go Ã¢â‚¬Ëœyeah, theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re as good as theyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve ever beenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½
